name: Datadog
description: Push custom metrics, traces, and monitor alerts from your agent workflows.
setupInstructions: Create an API key and app key, then configure your telemetry sink in the agent runtime.
steps: Create Datadog API and APP keys in Organization Settings
Store secrets in your environment or vault
Define metric namespace and tags for your agent
Send a test gauge metric to verify ingestion

configSchemaHints.notes: Use region-specific site if your org is in EU or US3/US5.

name: Grafana Cloud
description: Stream logs and metrics from agent runs into Grafana dashboards and alerts.
setupInstructions: Provision a Grafana Cloud stack and create an ingest token for Loki or Prometheus endpoints.
steps: Create a Grafana Cloud stack
Generate access policy token with metrics:write/logs:write
Configure endpoint URLs for your stack
Send a test payload and validate in Explore

configSchemaHints.notes: Prefer short-lived tokens with restricted policies.

name: AWS S3
description: Persist memory snapshots, artifacts, and generated files in object storage.
setupInstructions: Create an IAM user/role with scoped bucket access and configure region credentials.
steps: Create S3 bucket and IAM policy
Grant PutObject/GetObject/ListBucket permissions
Set credentials as environment variables
Upload a test object from your agent

configSchemaHints.notes: Use IAM roles in production rather than long-lived static keys.

configExamples.title: YAML config
configExamples.content:
provider: aws-s3
bucket: agent-artifacts-prod
region: us-west-2
prefix: foragents/

name: PostgreSQL
description: Store structured run history, tool logs, and analytics for long-term querying.
setupInstructions: Provision a database, create a least-privilege role, and configure connection pooling.
steps: Create database and service user
Enable SSL and network restrictions
Set DATABASE_URL in environment
Run migration to create integration tables

configSchemaHints.notes: If using serverless, route through a pooler like PgBouncer.

name: Slack
description: Deliver agent alerts, workflow updates, and approval requests into Slack channels.
setupInstructions: Create a Slack app with incoming webhooks and chat:write scope.
steps: Create Slack app in your workspace
Enable Incoming Webhooks and install app
Copy webhook URL and optional bot token
Post a message to validate channel access

configSchemaHints.notes: Use separate webhooks per environment to avoid noisy channels.

name: Discord
description: Notify community channels and trigger agent actions from Discord commands.
setupInstructions: Create a bot application, enable intents, and install it to your server.
steps: Create Discord application and bot
Copy bot token and application id
Enable required Gateway intents
Invite bot via OAuth2 URL
Run a ping command to verify

configSchemaHints.notes: Avoid enabling privileged intents unless your bot needs them.

name: GitHub Actions
description: Trigger and monitor CI workflows from agent decisions and release automation.
setupInstructions: Create a PAT or GitHub App token and grant workflow permissions for target repositories.
steps: Generate token with repo and workflow scopes
Set owner/repo defaults
Trigger workflow_dispatch event
Poll workflow run status until completion

configSchemaHints.notes: GitHub App auth is preferred for org-wide production setups.

name: Vercel
description: Create preview or production deployments directly from agent workflows.
setupInstructions: Generate a Vercel token and connect the project/team identifiers you deploy.
steps: Create API token in account settings
Capture VERCEL_PROJECT_ID and VERCEL_TEAM_ID
Call deployments endpoint with target branch
Check deployment status and surface URL

configSchemaHints.notes: Use preview deployments for agent-generated changes before promoting to production.

configExamples.title: Deployment YAML
configExamples.content:
provider: vercel
projectId: prj_123
teamId: team_123
target: preview

name: Sentry
description: Capture runtime exceptions and performance traces from autonomous agent tasks.
setupInstructions: Create a DSN and auth token, then initialize SDK in your task runtime.
steps: Create Sentry project
Copy DSN and auth token
Initialize SDK with environment and release
Emit a test exception

configSchemaHints.notes: Reduce traces sample rate in high-volume production environments.

name: HashiCorp Vault
description: Manage secrets and dynamic credentials for secure agent operations.
setupInstructions: Enable AppRole or token auth and restrict policies to only required secret paths.
steps: Deploy Vault and enable auth method
Create least-privilege policy
Generate AppRole credentials
Fetch a secret in your agent startup

configSchemaHints.notes: Prefer short-lived dynamic secrets and rotate credentials automatically.

configExamples.title: AppRole YAML
